name: Grand Hotel Bonanno

reviews.text: We are a Dutch familiy, married with 2 teenage girls, who live and work at the Garda Lake in Italy. We just came back from Pisa where we stayed in the Grand Hotel Bonanno for 2 nights from November 1th till November 3th. The reservation was made over the Internet just a day before. Our stay was good, the rooms were nice, with big beds that were a little bit hard. The bathroom was not very clean, there where hairs on some spots. We knew that the hotel was not located directly in the center of Pisa but within a 10 minutes walk you're in the center of Pisa. Therefore we liked the location. There is a free parking behind the hotel, only for guests of the hotel. Staff is friendly and the continental breakfast is great. Lots to choose from.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel, nice rooms, great breakfast and lovily stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked out we expected that the staff was interested in oud stay but the didn't ask anything. Because we work ourselves in the touristic business we think this is a chance the missed because you can learn a lot from your guests.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for a Saturday night. Room perfectly fine. Large bed and clean bathroom etc. Had a TV with SKY world news etc. Also there is free internet in the rooms (a little slow but cant complain for free!) Buffet breakfast was great - large selection and good quality. Staff very helpful and friendly. Very close to walk to the Leaning Tower. A little further (about 20mins) to the main station walking. Not too many resturants around the Hotel so need to walk somewhere if you don't want to eat in the hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful staff, comfy beds and spotless...very enjoyable stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from staying at this lovely hotel. Lovely selection of breakfast food. Really helpful staff. Superbly clean. Rooms fairly bijoux, but totally adequate and decent size bathroom with lovely shower. Location was slightly off the main area, however, this meant a quiet nights sleep and also made us appreciate more of Pisa than the main sights. Excellent Graffiti in the subway too! We booked via Lastminute.com and got a really good deal, worth checking!
reviews.title: Small rooms, nice lobby, surprisingly great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Grand Hotel Bananno our last night in Italy before flying out of the Pisa airport to London. The hotel is within a 7-10 minute walk of the leaning tower, an 8 euro cab ride from the train station, and a 18 euro cab ride from the airport. It is not located in the most happening part of town and I don't recommend walking home after sunset from the main shopping street - long walk with nothing in between.
reviews.title: relaxing and comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable in giving us directions and recommendations for restaurants. We couldn't complain about the buffet breakfast as there was a good selection of cereals, fruit, cold meats, cheeses and cooked items.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean.

reviews.text: Location wise, it is not far from the Leaning Tower (15 minutes) or the train station for Florence (25 minutes). We discovered a gelateria (Yogurteria) on via Francesco Crispi and treated ourselves to delicious yoghurt ice creams for three days.
reviews.title: Go stay there

reviews.text: Oddly though it is on the other side of an underpass. Our comfortable air-conditioned room overlooked the underpass but the noise of the traffic was not noticeable.
reviews.title: Good but wierd location
Would Recommend
reviews.text: On the night before our departure, we booked the shuttle service to Pisa Airport and this option is definitely recommended! On the designation of ratings, I would say that it is in between a Travelodge and a Holiday Inn Express.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good 5 day stay at this hotel. Reception and Restaurant people very helpful. Breakfast very good, perhaps more fresh fruit and introduction of nuts would be a good idea. Trains though passing nearby are not heard. Beds are comfortable. We took a three bedroomed - an originally big room divided by a wardrobe. Toiletries and towels are replenished/changed daily. If you take something from frigo bar expect it to be replaced the following day by chambermaid. Don't make plans to replace it yourself. A small bottle of water from the hotel is 2 Euro. Elsewhere much cheaper. Transfers/trips to Central Train Station and the use of van when required is very efficient. Trains efficient. We've been to Florence, San Gimignano, Lucca, Siena, Cinque Terre and naturally Pisa.
reviews.title: A really good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Field of miracles. It is close to a busy road, but don't worry as it is very well sound proofed. We had a room over looking the road but were not troubled by any noise. The room had double glazing and a shutter that excluded any noise. Others have commented adversely about the underpass that you have to take to get on the road to the Leaning Tower. We used it late at night and and during the day and had no worries .It is actually a footpath along side and above the road. You can see clearly from one end to the other before entering. If you are arriving by train get off at Pisa St Rossalare. It's only a 5 minute walk to the Hotel. The room we had was spacious, really clean and had the largest bed I've ever slept in. The staff are helpful, quite friendly, and speak english. The breakfast is excellent, but let down by poor coffee, (in Italy!) and orange juice. There are not many restaurants within walking distance in the area. We ate in the Hotel restauant and and found the quality and portion size to be excellent. Not cheap but what you would expect in a 4 * hotel. However the pizzas are cooked from frozen, but it does say so on the menu. Excellent Hotel. Recommended. I would certainly use it again. Booked through Otel.com, who were the cheapest.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel close to the major sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed 3 days B and B in this bright, friendly and modern hotel less that a kilometre from the Tower.The reviews are overly concerned about the underpass outside -not a problem as it's a very quiet underpass and the location is excellent overall- very safe.The breakfast is comprehensive and adequate- the rooms are small but comfortable- we took the advice of an earlier reviewer and got a room at the back which, for the price,was excellent. We didn't eat in the hotel in the evening as there are some nice restaurants in Pisa- go where the Italians go
reviews.title: Excellent value, attentive staff,positive experience

reviews.text: The location is great to visit Pisa.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: A wolk of some 15 mins to the Tower. Very close to the main street, even though the traffic might be too loud especially if the room is on the front of Hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, not so well Located

reviews.text: Breakfast is ok but coffee is desappointingly bad.
reviews.title: Friendly service, good location with free parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel thinking it would be a great location to visit Pisa.
reviews.title: Perfect place for 1 night"

reviews.text: Afterwards, we decided to actually visit some more cities, and therefore the location was probably not the best. Although the hotel is located next to a small station, correspondances to the central station are quite rare and it takes about 30min to go to the central station on foot.
reviews.title: Very satisfied!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighborhood is very calm, but the proximity of the station kinda gives an unsafe feeling at night.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Clean hotel, good location but not what I expected!!
reviews.text: The hotel in itself on the contrary was very pleasant and clean, the people at the reception friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was smaller than expected and the matrass very hard, but it was ok anyway.
reviews.title: Does the job

description: The new Grand Hotel Bonanno is just 800 mt from the Leaning Tower and the old town center, strategically placed near the main road of access to the town. The Hotel has 89 rooms, all equipped with air conditioning, Sky TV, minibar, hair dryer and safe.Furthermore the hotel has a free private parking area, perfect for your trip in Tuscany. Monuments, university, railway station, motorway, the Galileo Galilei International Airport, and the Congress Hall are not far away from the hotel.
